p: To confirm the dependability of the selected reference genes for standardization, we investigated the expression patterns of SbF6H and SbF8H in different tissues. When standardized with the top two most appropriate reference genes ( Î²-TUB and UBC) and their combination, the expression levels of SbF6H and SbF8H were highest in the root (Fig. 4). These findings are coincident with the expression profiles of SbF6H and SbF8H previously reported in S. baicalensis [ 11]. However, when normalized with the unstable gene ACT11, the expression patterns of SbF6H and SbF8H were quite different from previous report [ 11], and these two genes showed the highest expression level in the stem and leaf, respectively (Fig. 4). Therefore, the selection of an inappropriate reference gene may cause biased results. Here, analysis of the expression profiles of SbF6H and SbF8H indicted that the chosen reference genes were reliable for qRT-PCR standardization.
